lines.text:
[to Rosemary]
If a woman's going to ask me to marry her, the least she could do is say "Please."
Mom, you don't love someone because he's perfect.
If she loses her chance when she's young, she might as well throw all her prettiness away.
I'm only 19.
And next summer you'll be 20, and then 21, and then 40.
You don't have to be morbid.

When I graduate from college I'm going to New York, and write novels that'll shock people right out of their senses. I'm never gonna fall in love. Not me! I'm not gonna live in some jerkwater town and marry some ornery guy and raise some grimy kids. But just because I'm a dope doesn't mean you have to be.
Millie.
Go with him, Madge.
Millie?
For once in your life, do something right.
I gotta get somewhere in this world. I just gotta.
The ones we love are always pretty, but the ones who are pretty to begin with... everyone loves them.
You went for that Owens girl, didn't you?
I get so tired of just being told I'm pretty.
How do you talk to boys?
Why you just talk silly.
Well, but, how do you think of things to say?
You just say whatever comes into your head.
Supposing nothing ever comes into my head?
Oh, Ma, what is it just to be pretty?
Look at that sunset, Howard!
A sunset's a beautiful thing, all right.
It's like the daytime didn't want to end, isn't it? It's like the daytime was gonna put up a big scrap, set the world on fire to keep the night from creeping on.
What's the use, Baby? I'm a bum. She saw through me like an x-ray machine. There's no place in the world for a guy like me.

[Giddily to her schoolteacher friends just prior to eloping]
So long, girls! You know what you can tell the principal for me!
Where is everybody?
At a picnic everybody disappears. Don't you remember, Flo?
Now, don't you blow your top, ma'am. I'm leaving town.
[Turning to Madge]
Aren't you gonna say good bye?
bye.
Are you mad at me?
no
I gotta know how you feel. Last night I thought you liked me.
I did like you. I liked you from the first time I saw you.
Madge, are you out of your senses?
Look. I, I've been thinking all night. I've never said this before, because it... It'd make me seem like such a freak, but...
What?
I love you, Madge. Do you hear?
Millie, I want you in the house this minute.
Do you love me? Do you?
I'm gonna call the police and have you put where you belong.

[Train horn sounds]
If you please, ma'am. I'm catching that freight. Meet me baby. We'll get married. They'll give me a room in the hotel. It'll be ok until we find something better.
Oh, Madge, don't listen.
[Train horn sounds twice]
Come on.
oh, Hal, I can't.
Why?
Don't you see why? Don't you?
[Train horn sounds several blasts]
Listen, baby, you're the only real thing I ever wanted, ever. You're mine. I gotta claim what's mine, or I'll be nothing as long as I live. You love me. You know it. You love me.
[as train passes, Hal runs to jump a freighter, shouting]
You love me.
[Hal turns as he runs for passing freight train]
You love me.
oh, Madge...
[Madge runs up to her room and Flo walks to Mrs. Potts]
You liked him, didn't you Helen?

Everything so prim, the geranium in the window, the smell of mama's medicines. And then he walked in, and it was different! He clomped through the place like he was still outdoors. There was a man in the place and it seemed good!
You've got your troubles, and I've got mine.
I'm tellin' ya, Benson, women are getting desperate!
